item.title: By: bluekar
item.dc:creator: bluekar
item.description: I have yet to have a transmute proc, so I sigh in envy at my guildmates making 20 elixirs or potions with the mats for 10.
item.content:encoded: I have yet to have a transmute proc, so I sigh in envy at my guildmates making 20 elixirs or potions with the mats for 10.

item.title: By: Gemma
item.dc:creator: Gemma
item.description:
I've not specialised yet, and apart from the fact it looks like most have gone with transmutation, would the elixir or potion specialisation be more profitable as there is no cooldown?
The guild is gone, I'm in it for me...
item.content:encoded:
I’ve not specialised yet, and apart from the fact it looks like most have gone with transmutation, would the elixir or potion specialisation be more profitable as there is no cooldown?

The guild is gone, I’m in it for me…

item.title: By: bluekar
item.dc:creator: bluekar
item.description: I had this discussion with a fellow Alchemist. I will be keeping all extras I make on transmutes unless there is some kind of other arrangement made. There is a huge investment in Transmutation Mastery, and I shouldn't get nothing out of the time and effort I put into that mastery, not to mention blowing my cooldown time for someone. I might split any procs with a guildmate, but even that is not guaranteed.
item.content:encoded: I had this discussion with a fellow Alchemist. I will be keeping all extras I make on transmutes unless there is some kind of other arrangement made. There is a huge investment in Transmutation Mastery, and I shouldn’t get nothing out of the time and effort I put into that mastery, not to mention blowing my cooldown time for someone. I might split any procs with a guildmate, but even that is not guaranteed.

item.title: By: Heather
item.dc:creator: Heather
item.description: I'm with Elbows on this one. Due to the resources that go into specializing I'd probably expect to keep the extra (excepting with Guildies... although if I was the Guildy getting the transmute I'd tell 'em they could have the extra as a tip). However, I think Elbows' suggestion of waiving any fee or tip in that instance is nice.
item.content:encoded: I’m with Elbows on this one. Due to the resources that go into specializing I’d probably expect to keep the extra (excepting with Guildies… although if I was the Guildy getting the transmute I’d tell ’em they could have the extra as a tip). However, I think Elbows’ suggestion of waiving any fee or tip in that instance is nice.

item.title: By: Elbows
item.dc:creator: Elbows
item.description: Yea I think if it's a business transaction that the alchemist should keep the extra, however, if I was the alchemist I would probably waive any fee in the event that this happened.
item.content:encoded: Yea I think if it’s a business transaction that the alchemist should keep the extra, however, if I was the alchemist I would probably waive any fee in the event that this happened.

item.title: By: Cyndre
item.dc:creator: Cyndre
item.description:
Gotta agree with the other alchys here.
Guildies get both, business transaction, I keep the extra.
item.content:encoded:
Gotta agree with the other alchys here.

Guildies get both, business transaction, I keep the extra.

item.title: By: Begbie
item.dc:creator: Begbie
item.description: For a friend/guild mate - sure thing. For anyone else - you provide the mats for one item, you receive one item in return. Any extras are the alchemists to keep without question.
item.content:encoded: For a friend/guild mate – sure thing. For anyone else – you provide the mats for one item, you receive one item in return. Any extras are the alchemists to keep without question.

item.title: By: Nyquill
item.dc:creator: Nyquill
item.description: If you're not in the same party, only the alchemist will know, right?
item.content:encoded: If you’re not in the same party, only the alchemist will know, right?

item.title: By: Torron
item.dc:creator: Torron
item.description:
I've already discussed this with some of the other Alchemists in our guild. We seem to agree that for guildies, you hand over the extra items. For non guildies, you keep them and don't tell the guy you just did the transmute or potions for.
Obviously this goes out the window if you don't like that guildy you just did the transmute for.
item.content:encoded:
I’ve already discussed this with some of the other Alchemists in our guild. We seem to agree that for guildies, you hand over the extra items. For non guildies, you keep them and don’t tell the guy you just did the transmute or potions for.

Obviously this goes out the window if you don’t like that guildy you just did the transmute for.

item.title: By: Ghiest
item.dc:creator: Ghiest
item.description:
<blockquote>Alchemist put resources into his mastery, if you should earn 4 primal mights back from tips it will take forever to get a break even. Optional for the requester to buy the second primal at reduced price.</blockquote>
Depends really, if it's a guildy who is transmuting for me I'm pretty sure (as we only have two that I supplied 60-70% of the mats to <strong>get </strong>that mastery ) they will hand over both. But I do not expect it and wouldn't be offended if I didn't get it. If it was some shmo that was spamming it in the trade chan I wouldn't expect him to hand over both :)
item.content:encoded:
Alchemist put resources into his mastery, if you should earn 4 primal mights back from tips it will take forever to get a break even. Optional for the requester to buy the second primal at reduced price.

Depends really, if it’s a guildy who is transmuting for me I’m pretty sure (as we only have two that I supplied 60-70% of the mats to get that mastery ) they will hand over both. But I do not expect it and wouldn’t be offended if I didn’t get it. If it was some shmo that was spamming it in the trade chan I wouldn’t expect him to hand over both 🙂
